unnormalised: Quality control is crucial for the success of the 'Make in India' initiative. Robust QC processes minimize defects, reduce waste, and ensure customer satisfaction, ultimately boosting competitiveness. A faulty gear manufactured in Faridabad can halt a Mumbai local train, highlighting the stakes.
